title: How do people with ADHD get themselves to read books on ADHD? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you’re interested in the subject, then it probably will not be much of a problem. While ADHD is characterized by a lack of focus, for a number of folks they also have a sort of “hyper-focus.” The can zoom in on something and stay with it in an almost compulsive fashion. I heard a story of someone who was so hyper-focused on a subject that they didn’t acknowledge a fire alarm in their building and the emergency responders had to get them to evacuate. If you find ADHD books that fascinating, then many ADHD people will devour them. I love just about any writing on the brain. I’ve never had a problem reading books on ADHD.

I’m currently reading Understanding Girls with ADHD, Updated and Revised: How They Feel and Why They Do What They Do by Kathleen Nadeau, Littman, and Quinn, because, hey, may daughter is awesome, and even more ADD than I am. I leave the book on my chair, or a shelf, or anyplace I’m likely to see it. Whenever I do, I pick it up and read a few pages. Then I go do something else while I think about it. Having to pick it up and move it in order to sit down actually reminds me to read it.
